item.title: Street Lighting in Blissett Street, 25th September
item.description:
As the nights get darker earlier, I notice that the street lighting is quite poor along Blissett Street where the houses are opposite the Fire Station. Can something be done on this as it does not feel as safe walking along here when there are huge gaps in lighting along much of this street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1 - 14, Greenwich South Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: What is the mayor of Hackney doing about this inconvenience the cut through mare Street to Tesco's has been closed off causing elderly and vulnerable people have to walk the long way around who are very unwell and have mobility issues.Disabled access alleyway needs to be reopened ASAP. This is disgraceful vulnerable and elderly people., 25th September
item.description:
Key access route for vulnerable elderly people and disable motability users has been closed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip which was on verge has been moved to roadway to obstruct vehicle., 25th September
item.description:
Fly tip which was originally on verge/hedge outside the flats (with abandoned Lime bike previously reported) has been moved onto the roadway and obstructs vehicles. Glass in fly tip has been broken in front of vehicle tyres. Lime bike appears to have been re-fly tipped/moved elsewhere. #14 again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Challin Street, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large fridge freezer and window frames including smashed glass, 25th September
item.description:
Nearly four weeks ago someone left a large upright fridge freezer outside 18 Kidbrooke Grove. A couple of days ago someone has added some window frames with smashed windows. This is now a health and safety issue particularly due to the smashed glass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Kidbrooke Grove, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near controlled Zone panel, 25th September
item.description:
Cycle lane going down haverstock hill stops without any sign leading to prince of Wales road. Therefore cyclists think they need to cut on the left over the pavement, but unfortunately the Edge of the pavement is high and not clearly visible. The result is a Very dangerous edge for cyclists. It was dangerous for me, and I also saw another cyclist crashing in from of me against the Controlled zone panel on another occasion. You should fix this before someone seriously injures himself or worse against that pavement/panel.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haverstock Hill, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
